text: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/reference/api/marketing/subscriptions-preferences#post-%2Fcommunication-preferences%2Fv3%2Fresubscribe|According to this new API doc>, we can now resubscribe contacts which was not possible previously. Does anyone know if it's possible to resubscribe contacts?

Oh if only
From the docs
“This API is not valid to use for resubscribing a contact at a brand or portal level and will return an error.”

I think it’s for an instance when someone unchecks a particular subscription and hit’s update.

If someone clicks unsubscribe from all I guess given the above statement it will not allow them to be resubscribed
I may be wrong though, I really hope i’ve mis-interpreted it
all of these search results are returning a 404 on the doc site
Hi everyone, does anyone have experience with captcha design? As soon as I turn captcha on, the design created within webflow gets lost and transits back to its original HubSpot form. Any got a clue?
Hmm... I wonder if this has anything to do with the new beta of the docs site being launched today?  <@U03PJER6S8P>

Hey <@U01GW2U4WMA> they're actually using two different data sources and APIs for search and content. We might have had some folks internally move content around on the old site improperly, but we're looking into this one and will hopefully know more shortly.
Hi everyone is there a way to return the usage of a property using the api?

Hey Rene, if you mean to check what each property of an object (contacts, companies, deals, tickets, notes, emails, etc...) then you can call the schema for that.

`/crm/v3/schemas/{objectType}`
No, I'm trying to get the usage levels of said a property. i.e if i have 100 companies, if its being used in say 20 of them

Hey all! Just searched a bit but couldn't find anything. Forgive me if this has been asked.

I made a private app and am trying to pull feedback form data. I've granted the scope for `crm.objects.feedback_submissions.read` but am still getting a 403 stating that I don't have the required scope... but this App has ONLY this scope. Any ideas?

Actually, looks like this was documented here as well: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C2YHAHB6K/p1669819185777609>

With no followup.
Hey <@U04DGJN4GRX>, did you ever figure this out? I'm having the same issue.

I show a different endpoint to read a submission using the latest api version - v3 which is in beta but maybe you'll have better luck:  <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/feedback-submissions>

Thanks for the reply! I was first trying to list the submissions, then would want to read each:

`/crm/v3/objects/feedback_submissions` is what gives a 403
hey everyone! im in a bit over my head and looking for some clarity- does anyone know whether private apps/ API's can talk to external apps then execute tasks within HubSpot?
Yeah - This is all possible.  What are you trying to accomplish?
Scape websites for keywords related to ICP, make list of companies that already exist as to whether they fit or not

Ok - very cool.

Can you describe the use case?

What websites will the app scrape?
Who will input the "keywords"?
List of Companies will be current/existing "Companies" from within your HubSpot account?
Is it correct to assume you have an existing "external" app which does all the scraping?

use case is lead qualification, leaving it for us to just double check and priortize target accounts
i have a list of conpanies and websites, almost 2k, that would take a long time

for input it will be set keywords, so not sure where they need to be input
yes they do already exist
working on it now yes regarding the scraper

Ok.

I think then all you need is the Private App key which you external App uses and then from there you can make all the GET/POST requests to your HubSpot account.
You can setup webhooks/events which can then trigger your external app to run but the use case for this is a bit unclear.
I have a use case where you are viewing a prospect / company record and then want to see all the related clients based on matching properties, etc.

ideally i feed scaper the thousands of website and it starts sifting through and makes lists of those that dont contain the keywords and those that do and those that are unclear, cutting down most of the time that i spend doing all of that manually

Makes total sense...

If I were you, I would start with your scraper to output a CSV with HubSpot Comany ID and the results from your scraper.

Then you can upload this to HubSpot to bulk update the companies.

Focus on the scraper and make sure it works as expected before spending time with API's and updating records.

Another option is to invest in a external resource who can do this "manual" scraping effort for you.  DM me if you are looking for a part-time resource to help you with this - I have resources available.
I'd love to see if anyone else has thoughts on the subject but that's my 2 cents :slightly_smiling_face:
all very helpful ryan thanks!!
I have the same question. Has this ever been answered?

A batch read request can be sort to a specific property?
